title: 110_hr1196
content:
The "Intelligence Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2007" authorizes appropriations for intelligence activities. Funds are authorized for intelligence activities of various US Government elements for fiscal year 2007, including the Office of the Director of National Intelligence, CIA, Department of Defense, Defense Intelligence Agency, NSA, State Department, Treasury Department, Energy Department, Justice Department, FBI, National Reconnaissance Office, National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency, and Coast Guard. The National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency, Coast Guard, Department of Homeland Security, and Drug Enforcement Administration are among the US Government elements authorized funds for intelligence activities in fiscal year 2007. SEC. 102 of the bill specifies the amounts and personnel ceilings for intelligence activities in the classified Schedule of Authorizations. This schedule will be shared with the Committees on Appropriations and the President. SEC. 103 allows for adjustments to personnel ceilings. SEC. 103 allows the Director of National Intelligence to exceed personnel ceilings with approval from the Office of Management and Budget for important intelligence functions. The Director must notify the Senate and House Intelligence Committees when exercising this authority. Authorization of Appropriations for the Intelligence Community Management Account for fiscal year 2007 is $990,000,000. Authorized personnel levels are set at 1,539 full-time personnel as of September 30, 2007. Personnel may be permanent employees or detailed from other government elements. Additional appropriations are authorized for classified purposes. In addition to the authorized appropriations for the Intelligence Community Management Account for fiscal year 2007, there are additional amounts specified in the classified Schedule of Authorizations for advanced research and development, available until September 30, 2007. Additional personnel are also authorized for elements of the Intelligence Community Management Account as of September 30, 2007, as specified in the classified Schedule of Authorizations. During fiscal year 2007, officers, employees, or members of the Armed Forces detailed to the Intelligence Community Management Account from other government elements must be reimbursed, unless specified by the Director of National Intelligence for temporary functions. TITLE II--CENTRAL INTELLIGENCE AGENCY RETIREMENT AND DISABILITY SYSTEM

Authorization of $256,400,000 for the Central Intelligence Agency Retirement and Disability Fund for fiscal year 2007.

TITLE III--GENERAL PROVISIONS

Increases in employee compensation and benefits authorized by law can be funded by additional appropriations. Restrictions on intelligence activities not authorized by the Constitution or laws of the United States.
